intro: Centaurea stricta, commonly known as the slender centaury, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive purple or red central disc, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields. Centaurea stricta is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
